me.tatarka.ipromise

Class CancelableTask<T>

  • java.lang.Object
    • me.tatarka.ipromise.Task<T>
      • me.tatarka.ipromise.CancelableTask<T>
  • Type Parameters:
    T - the result type

    public class CancelableTask<T>
extends Task<T>
    A Task the implements a simple method of cancellation. Specifically, it will call ExecutorService.shutdownNow(). In most cases this will interrupt the thread the callback is running on.
    See Also:
    Task

    • Method Detail

      • run

        public static <T> Promise<T> run(Task.Do<T> callback)
        Runs the callback in a separate thread, delivering the result in the returned Promise. This is equivalent to: new CancelableTask(callback).start().
        Type Parameters:
        T - the result type
        Parameters:
        callback - the callback to run in a separate thread.
        Returns:
        the promise that will deliver the result

      • run

        public static <T> Promise<T> run(java.util.concurrent.ExecutorService executor,
                                 Task.Do<T> callback)
        Runs the callback with the given Executor, delivering the result in the returned Promise. This is equivalent to: new CancelableTask(executor, callback).start().
        Type Parameters:
        T - the result type
        Parameters:
        executor - the executor to use to run the callback.
        callback - the callback
        Returns:
        the promise that will deliver the result
